column5: I now know that I'll be out of her hair for sure! What else could a gal ask for after 36 years?  A muffler and break pads?
Did that last month.... as well as 5 new brake lines and a front hub!
A muffler and break pads?  She has a new snow plow truck to play with while he,s away Mike.  Now thats love. LOL
Yes.. yes she does! If you call a '98 "new"... replacement would be a better word! lol
It,s the thought Wayne.
Just a good meal and some alone time?
We go out  for some fun.
I'm getting mine a one way train ticket to Toronto so she can join me for musky Sunday and family day at the spring boat and fishing show.

I will be cooking (and cleaning up after) a nice meal for my darling wife and 5 year old daughter. They are excited. It will be a break from the everyday. I don't do it often enough due to work commitments but they absolutely love it anytime I take / make the opportunity.
She got a new van...  And we are doing a family ice fish on Saturday... And after the kids are asleep order some munchies and try to find a good movie...
I'll likely have to give her a phone call on Valentines Day.

I'm lucky to be married to a girl who isn't a fan of Valentine's day - she calls it the day that a lot of men use to try and make up for what they do (or don't do) the rest of the year, so we have never treated it as anything special. Instead, I show up with flowers at random times during the year for "no reason at all" and get a lot more mileage out of that. It's been working for 35 years so i must be doing something right

I wasn't going to get her anything..  But last night, she told me she has already bought me something.  So know I need to starting thinking about something.  I'll hit up Victoria Secret on my way home Friday.  Get her something pink.
Bowchickawowow  one can only hope

When Sue and I first got together we both had debts and not a lot of money left over so the very first Valentine's day I couldn't afford to give her much but I did give her a single red rose because she was the "One and Only", (and it was all I could afford) and I cooked her a nice dinner dinner of fresh trout (her favorite food is anything to do with fish).  33 years later and I still give her a single red rose because she is still the One and Only and I am still cooking her a really nice dinner. This year it is going to be scallops, crab legs, lobster tails, and a maple crusted salmon fillet with a side of brown and wild rice. I'll probably pick up a bottle of her favorite red wine too (I realize that red wine isn't supposed to go with seafood but it does go with the red rose LOL).  What Sue gives me in return...... I'll never tell

When Sue and I first got together we both had debts and not a lot of money left over so the very first Valentine's day I couldn't afford to give her much but I did give her a single red rose because she was the "One and Only", (and it was all I could afford) and I cooked her a nice dinner dinner of fresh trout (her favorite food is anything to do with fish).  33 years later and I still give her a single red rose because she is still the One and Only and I am still cooking her a really nice dinner. This year it is going to be scallops, crab legs, lobster tails, and a maple crusted salmon fillet with a side of brown and wild rice. I'll probably pick up a bottle of her favorite red wine too (I realize that red wine isn't supposed to go with seafood but it does go with the red rose LOL).  What Sue gives me in return...... I'll never tell And TRUST me this man can COOK..........his screen name should be CHIEF CLIFF ....
Ummmm, french onion soup
She told me she wanted me to be happy on Valentines Day so I got me a new drill press.......good idea?
To answer the topic question   nothing
Besides you know what in the morning what are you guys planning on getting her.  Myself I'm just grabbing flowers and a card.  Something simple for a simple girl.
My wife has had ME for 48 + years, what else could a girl want ??
Dinner at Shakespeares.
I already gave mine her valentines day present. A set of 3 throwing knives she had wanted for a while.  I love that woman.
Mine is begging to take her fishing again. Rough life eh?  S.
I'm going on a fishing trip and leaving her in peace for 10 days, she seems happy about the gift

We haven't done a thing for V day since well...forever. Just another day on the calendar around here. We both know what the other one wants or needs and make an effort 12 months of the year to look after those things.  Used to be a restaurant in town that had a real nice Valentine's day special menu supper.  Bottle of wine, appetizers a few selections for your main course and a few great dessert choices. Looked forward to that but they have stopped doing it.
The letter "L" which stands for Lucia our youngest granddaughter for her charm bracelet. Ordered it online and it should be here any day now....it better be....Grrrrrrrrrrr
A new muffler and break pads LOL!
And a hole in your canoe she wil give you! Lol
Necklace
A new muffler and break pads LOL!    Maybe if all the guys on the forum take your advice Mike we will all get to fish as much as you, mines getting brake pads and a muffler too

Maybe if all the guys on the forum take your advice Mike we will all get to fish as much as you, mines getting brake pads and a muffler too I have no problem buying her a new muffler and break pads, heck I'll even splurge for new rotors while I'm at it.........but she has to install them........
were going on a trip to mexico cause our anniversary is tomorrow. I also got her flowers to be delivered at work and am going to buy us chipotle for dinner, hang out and watch netflix together.
Bowchickawowow
Flowers at work on Friday, lunch in the fish hut Saturday.
My wife has had ME for 48 + years, what else could a girl want ??  When I seen the title and then seen this reply.  I said  BINGO  Works for me. LOL

Nothing special here. The kids like to be involved now so its usually dinner out. (they actually pick decent restaurants). No cards, but the wife takes the girls shopping for my valentines gift. usually canadian tire fishing section.
Nothing.. she and I agree that it's more of a day for companies to jack prices up for a winter cash boost, which is just fine but not from my pocket... working nights all weekend anyways...
A dozen roses, a card, a nice meal. After 45 years, it still pays dividends
I asked her what she wanted to do . She said the we should go to the spring fishing show and spend a couple of days in the city.
My " honey" is a dog, and he is happy with a treat or ice cube! That makes my life a lot easier! LOL
Had to laugh at the one on 640AM this morning, he said you better buy some expensive candy or Candy might not come across.
Well I'm done loading the truck and trailer.... I now know that I'll be out of her hair for sure! What else could a gal ask for after 36 years?
